column2: The Brass Chorus, a fixture of German Lutheran life and community, has a history of many brass instruments that play among the choir. Depending on your talents you can swing as high as the sopranos and altos or fall deep into the illustrious Bass and Tenor which together make for a harmoniously perfect performance. Which one of them will you choose?
The Trumpet, in the tradition of Bach.
The Trombone, a resounding part of a concerto.
The Althorn, the father of all the Saxhorns.
The Baritone, reverberates from the depths of my soul.
